messages.title: LISTENING TO YOU, CAMPAIGNING FOR YOU

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Peter won his campaign and got the NHS to treat patients with wet macular degeneration which, untreated, causes blindness.

Peter believes in supporting community needs: post offices fought against closure, with support from Councillor Barry Graves, Wilby and Great Doddington says, 'Peter led an energetic campaign against the closure of our village post office'.

issues.health: Peter Bone has a track record of campaigning on behalf of his constituents for better healthcare, as illustrated by his campaign on the NHS treatment for wet macular degeneration.

politicalExperience.achievements: 4th best voting record of any Conservative MP; one of the most active MPs in Parliament; 23 Petitions presented to Parliament; spoke in 164 debates last year and asked 138 written questions; Member of the Health Select Committee.

endorsements.endorsement: Without Peter's help, I would have gone blind.

quotes.text: Peter Bone is working hard with us on the Haven drop-in project.
Peter has always given us 100% support and associated with us.
The independent auditor of MPs' expenses found Peter's to be correct and in order. Sir Thomas Legg said 'Mr Bone has no issues'.

images.caption: Peter Bone interacting with constituents and engaging in various community campaigns.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Peter Bone has a weekly surgery in the constituency, produces the Listening Report, holds regular community meetings, 93% approval rating from residents and produces an Annual Listening Report. Supports local charities and community efforts.
